title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: Experience the rich, buttery goodness of this classic Southern pecan pie that boasts a perfectly flaky crust and a luscious, sweet filling studded with crunchy pecans. This timeless dessert is as beautiful as it is delicious, making it a show-stopping centerpiece for any gathering or special occasion.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in chilled butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix egg yolk with ice water and stir into flour mixture until dough forms a ball.
Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out dough and place in a 9-inch pie plate.
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Mix in eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract until well blended.
Pour filling mixture over pecans in the crust.
Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for an additional 40 to 50 minutes, or until golden brown and filling is set.
Allow pie to cool completely before serving to let filling firm up.
tips: Use chilled butter and ice water to ensure a flaky crust. Avoid overmixing the dough to keep it tender. Watch the pie closely during the last 10 minutes of baking to prevent over-browning. Let the pie cool fully to allow the filling to set perfectly for clean slices.

structured_content.content: Southern Pecan Pie II is a treasured classic that combines a tender, flaky crust with a rich, gooey filling packed with crunchy pecans. The sweet aroma of vanilla and butter fills your kitchen as it bakes, promising a comforting and indulgent treat that’s perfect for holidays or any special occasion.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 2 hours prep plus baking
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home with simple ingredients
  • Perfect for holidays, family gatherings, and celebrations
  • Uses classic Southern ingredients that create a nostalgic taste
  • A visually stunning pie that impresses with its golden crust and glossy pecan topping

structured_content.content: I received this recipe from my friend Joyce, who got it from an elderly Southern lady. Every time I bake this pie, it brings back warm memories of family gatherings and the joy of sharing a homemade dessert that everyone loves.

• Main ingredient: Fresh pecan halves provide the perfect crunch and nutty flavor essential to this pie. Make sure they are fresh and not rancid for the best taste.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract adds a warm, sweet aroma that elevates the filling’s flavor. Use pure vanilla for the best results.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter and eggs enrich the filling and crust, creating a creamy texture and golden color.
  • Equipment needed: A 9-inch pie plate, rolling pin, mixing bowls, and a sharp knife for trimming the crust edges.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in cold butter until crumbly. Mix egg yolk and ice water, then stir into flour mixture to form dough. Chill dough for at least 1 hour to ensure a flaky crust.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll out dough and fit into pie plate. Arrange pecans on crust bottom. Whisk together filling ingredients and pour over pecans. Bake at 450°F for 10 minutes, then reduce to 350°F and bake 40-50 minutes until golden and set.
Finishing Touches:
Cool the pie completely before slicing to allow the filling to firm up. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream for an extra indulgence.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Use chilled butter and ice water to create a flaky crust texture.
  • Avoid overbaking; the filling should be set but slightly jiggly in the center when done.
  • Look for a golden brown crust and glossy pecans as visual cues.
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerate for up to 4 days. Reheat gently if desired.

structured_content.content: This pie has been a family favorite for years, often bringing everyone together around the table. Sharing a slice with loved ones always feels like a warm embrace, reminding me of the simple joys of homemade Southern cooking.

Enhance the pie by adding a pinch of cinnamon or nutmeg to the filling for a warm spice note. Toast the pecans lightly before adding for extra depth. For a richer flavor, substitute half the corn syrup with maple syrup or honey.

Serve this pecan pie with a dollop of freshly whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Pair it with strong coffee or a glass of bourbon for a true Southern experience. It’s perfect for holiday dinners, potlucks, or casual weekend treats.

For a gluten-free version, use a gluten-free flour blend for the crust. Vegan adaptations can be made by substituting eggs with flax eggs and using vegan butter. Try adding chocolate chips or a layer of caramel sauce for a decadent twist.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Keep all crust ingredients cold for a flaky texture.
  • Chill the dough thoroughly before rolling to prevent shrinking.
  • Bake the pie on a lower oven rack to ensure even cooking of the crust bottom.
  • Brush the crust edges with egg wash for a shiny, golden finish.

structured_content.content: Don’t be intimidated by the process—this Southern Pecan Pie is a rewarding bake that fills your kitchen with irresistible aromas and your heart with pride. Enjoy every bite and the smiles it brings to your table!
